A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: As a longstanding Star Wars fan\, I wanted to love this movie\, but I didn't. It was as if everything J.J. Abrams set up in TFA was callously dismissed by Rian Johnson in The Last Jedi. Taking the franchise in a different direction wouldn't have necessarily been a bad decision on its own\, but the storyline in this 2 1/2 hour boondoggle was full off plot holes\, preachy PC messages\, and one disappointing turn after another. I liked Brick and Looper\, so I was excited to see what Johnson brought to the franchise. Again\, I wasn't against taking the new trilogy in a different direction\, but this was poorly executed and not really fun at all. I wasn't a fan.
